data.title: Flood alert for South of Thailand as river levels rise
data.description: Residents in low-lying areas of Nakhon Si Thammarat are advised to move valuables and vulnerable individuals to higher ground

data.title: Ratchaburi man busted with 50 rare exotic animals
data.description: A man has been arrested at his home in Ratchaburi for possessing dozens of  endangered wild animals  including cotton-top tamarin monkeys. He admitted to buying them online, police said on Friday.

data.title: Samui ferry operator considers lifting EV ban
data.description: SURAT THANI - The operator of ferries serving Koh Samui says it will reconsider lifting its ban on electric vehicles (EVs) early next year after installing firefighting equipment on all routes from the southern mainland to resort islands.

data.title: Bangchak oil prices to remain unchanged over holidays
data.description: Fuel giant announced that it will maintain its retail petrol and diesel prices for six days from December 28 despite global price increases

data.title: Transport Ministry to unveil ‘Houses for Thais’ on Jan 20
data.description: Targeting low- and mid-income earners, the initiative will utilise unused SRT land, starting with pilot sites in Bangkok, Pathum Thani, Thonburi and Chiang Mai

data.title: True’s “Happiness Express2” Brings New Year Smiles Across Thailand
data.description: True Corporation is ushering in 2025 with the “Happiness Express2” campaign, inviting all customers to embrace the festive season by reflecting on the joys of the past year and welcoming the New Year with endless smiles. Running until January 15, 2025, the campaign highlights True’s ultra-fast and reliable 5G connectivity, spreading happiness nationwide.

data.title: Millionaire woman among 12 beggars arrested in Bangkok
data.description: Twelve beggars were arrested in the inner Sukhumvit area of Bangkok on Thursday night, including a Thai woman who had earned over a million baht.

data.title: TIDLOR Shines with Four Awards at AdPeople 2024
data.description: Ngern Tid Lor Public Company Limited (TIDLOR) has clinched four prestigious awards at the AdPeople Awards & Symposium 2024, organized by the Advertising Association of Thailand. The accolades, awarded for the impactful “heygoody” and “Ngern Tidlor” campaigns, underscoring the company’s unwavering dedication to promoting digital insurance accessibility and improving financial inclusion for underbanked customers.

data.title: Switzerland plans revamp of Cold War-era nuclear bunker network

data.title: US warship makes rare visit to Cambodia base at centre of feud
data.description: The US will send a warship to visit a naval base in Cambodia for the first time since the Southeast Asian nation reportedly signed a deal in 2019 that would allow China to establish a permanent foothold there.

data.title: 12 beggars arrested in Bangkok,1 with B300,000 cash, B1m in bank account
data.description: Twelve Thai and foreign beggars were arrested during a police operation to purge Bangkok of beggars on Thursday night. One Thai beggar was found to be carrying more than 300,000 baht in cash and to have about one million baht in her bank account

data.title: FTAs help boost Thailand’s dairy exports by 11.5% year on year

data.title: Filipina on Indonesia death row says planned transfer 'miracle'
data.description: A Filipina drug convict on death row in Indonesia told AFP from prison Friday that her planned transfer was a "miracle", in her first interview since Manila and Jakarta signed an agreement last week to repatriate her.

data.title: 889 tourists evacuated as Phu Kradueng shuts down for safety reasons
data.description: The national park in Loei has been closed indefinitely after a wild elephant fatally attacked a tourist on Wednesday
